Rules.Name: Containers should not have cyclic dependencies
Rules.Description: Containers must not depend on each other in a cyclic manner to avoid tight coupling and maintainability issues.

Rules.Name: Frontend can not connect directly to database
Rules.Description: Frontend services should not connect directly to the database for security and architecture reasons.

Rules.Name: Container technology must be defined
Rules.Description: Each container must have a defined technology to ensure clarity in the architecture.

Rules.Name: Container technology must be one of the allowed technologies
Rules.Description: Containers should use only approved technologies to maintain consistency and supportability.

Rules.Name: Relationships from external systems to database are not allowed
Rules.Description: External systems should not have direct relationships to databases to ensure security and proper architecture.

Rules.Name: Relationship technology must be defined
Rules.Description: Each relationship must have a defined technology to ensure clarity in the architecture.

Rules.Name: Every container should have instance
Rules.Description: Each container should have at least one instance to ensure it is deployed and operational.
Rules.Expression: Tags.Contains("Container") and Identifier not_in @ModelElements.Where(e => e.Tags.Contains("Container Instance")).Select(e => e.InstanceOfIdentifier)

Rules.Name: Database container must not have outgoing relationships
Rules.Description: Database containers should not have outgoing relationships to ensure data integrity and proper architecture.
